choices.C: Assign GuestUser1 the SharePoint administrator role
choices.A: Add GuestUser1 to the Members group of the Sales site collection
choices.B: Assign a SharePoint Online Plan1 license to GuestUser1
choices.D: Add GuestUser1 to the Owners group of the Sales site collection

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft SharePoint Online site collection named Sales. You have an external user named GuestUser1 who has guest access to the Sales site collection.
You need to ensure that GuestUser1 can create additional subsites. The solution must use the principle of least privilege.
What is the best way to achieve the goal? More than one answer choice may achieve the goal. Select the BEST answer.

discussion.content:
Tested. Members can not create a subsites.
So the answer is D.
That's not true. Just tested it - members can make subsites.
I know, members can not add subsite. So need owner rights.

questions.question_text:
You plan to deploy Microsoft SharePoint Online sites.
You need to recommend a solution that provides consistent global navigation across multiple site collections.
Which navigation approach should you include in the recommendation?

discussion.content: Shouldn't it be hub site ? It talks about multiple site collections.

comments.content: I believe it should be hub site in spo.

discussion.content: I believe Managed Navigation would minimally suffice the requirement hence the answer. Hub has more like footer or style which is not asked or required in this question. Hence may not be so suitable?

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
All computers run Windows 8.1 or Windows 10.
All users are configured to use Microsoft OneDrive for Business.
You want the users to be able to use Files On-Demand.
You need to identify which computers are using an OneDrive sync client that must be updated.
For which executable should you monitor?

choices.D: Add Auditors as a My Site Secondary Admin
choices.B: Add auditors as site collection administrator of Contoso-my
choices.C: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, assign Auditors the Compliance Administrator role
choices.A: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, assign Auditors the Global administrator role

discussion.content:
I think that the correct answer is "C" because:
Compliance administrator Users with this role can help your organization stay compliant with any regulatory requirements, manage eDiscovery cases, and maintain data governance policies across Microsoft 365 locations, identities, and apps.

comments.content: The answer is D as its only asking for OneDrive specific sites not across the 365 tennant, so i'd agree its D

I don't see the point here. In order to create an eDiscovery case, you have to be privileged as an ediscovery manager or administrator
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/assign-ediscovery-permissions?view=o365-worldwide

questions.question_text:
You work for a company named Contoso, Ltd.
Contoso has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You plan to implement Microsoft OneDrive for Business for all users.
You need to ensure that a group named Auditors can perform eDiscovery for all new OneDrive sites. The solution must use the principle of least privilege.
What is the best way to achieve the goal? More than one answer choice may achieve the goal. Select the BEST answer.

choices.A: Add Admin1 to the Site owners group
choices.C: From Setup My Sites, add a secondary administrator
choices.B: From the SharePoint admin center, select user profiles, and then select Manage User Properties
choices.D: From the SharePoint admin center, select user profiles, and then select Manage User Profiles. Select User1, and then select Manage site collection owners

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You need to add a user named Admin1 as an administrator of the Microsoft OneDrive for Business site for a user named User1.
What should you do?
